objenome.solver.evolve.mutate

Class OnePointCrossover

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.AbstractOrganismOperator
      • objenome.solver.evolve.mutate.OnePointCrossover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware, OrganismOperator

    public class OnePointCrossover
extends AbstractOrganismOperator
implements Listener<ConfigEvent>
    A crossover operator for STGPIndividuals that exchanges subtrees in two individuals. Random crossover points are chosen in both program trees from those points which align in the two programs. Alignment is determined by nodes in the same position having the same arity and data-type, or for the strict form of the operator the nodes must be the same. The crossover points are located in the same position in both program trees and the two subtrees at these points are exchanged. It is recommended that a significant mutation rate (Poli & Langdon use 30%) is used in combination with one-point crossover since it encourages rapid convergence. For more information about the one-point crossover operator see:
    R.Poli and W.B.Langdon, Genetic Programming with One-Point Crossover
    Soft Computing in Engineering Design and Manufacturing, pp. 180-189, Springer-Verlag
    London, 23-27 June 1997.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    KozaCrossover, SubtreeCrossover

        • PROBABILITY
        • STRICT

      • perform

        public TypedOrganism[] perform(OperatorEvent.EndOperator event,
                               Organism... parents)
        Performs a one-point crossover on the given individuals. Random crossover points are chosen in both program trees from those points which align in the two programs. Alignment is determined by nodes in the same position having the same arity and data-type, or for the strict form of the operator the nodes must be the same. The crossover points are located in the same position in both program trees and the two subtrees at these points are exchanged. See the paper referenced in the class documation for more details of the operation of one-point crossover.
        Overrides:
        perform in class AbstractOrganismOperator
        Parameters:
        event - the EndOperator event to be filled with information about this operation
        parents - an array of two individuals to undergo one-point crossover. Both individuals must be instances of STGPIndividual.
        Returns:
        an array containing two STGPIndividuals that are the result of the crossover
        See Also:
        AbstractOrganismOperator.getEndEvent(Organism...)

      • inputSize

        public int inputSize()
        Returns the number of individuals expected by the operator.

        One-point crossover operates on 2 individuals.

      • setProbability

        public void setProbability(double probability)
        Sets the probability of this operator being selected. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the PROBABILITY configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        probability - the new probability to set

      • isStrict

        public boolean isStrict()
        Returns whether strict one-point crossover is being used or not. If set to true then alignment of the parent programs takes into account not only the arity of the nodes, but also the node type.
        Returns:
        true if strict one-point crossover is in use, and false otherwise

      • setStrict

        public void setStrict(boolean strict)
        Sets whether strict one-point crossover should be used or not. Strict one-point crossover causes alignment of the parent programs takes into account not only the arity of the nodes, but also the node type. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the STRICT configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        strict - true if strict one-point crossover should be used and false otherwise

      • getRandomSequence

        public RandomSequence getRandomSequence()
        Returns the random number sequence in use
        Returns:
        the currently set random sequence

      • setRandomSequence

        public void setRandomSequence(RandomSequence random)
        Sets the random number sequence to use. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set
